document.discussion_title: Jimmy Choo PLC (CHOO) Earns “Outperform” Rating from Royal Bank Of Canada
document.topic_text: Tweet Royal Bank Of Canada restated their outperform rating on shares of Jimmy Choo PLC (LON:CHOO) in a research report sent to investors on Wednesday. They currently have a GBX 150 ($1.93) price objective on the stock. Jimmy Choo PLC ( LON:CHOO ) opened at 110.00 on Wednesday. The stock’s market capitalization is GBX 415.56 million. Jimmy Choo PLC has a 52-week low of GBX 92.75 and a 52-week high of GBX 170.86. The company’s 50-day moving average price is GBX 107.48 and its 200 day moving average price is GBX 118.67. In other news, insider Murdoch,Elisabeth purchased 31,317 shares of the stock in a transaction dated Friday, July 8th. The shares were purchased at an average cost of GBX 109 ($1.40) per share, with a total value of £34,135.53 ($43,955.10). Other equities analysts have also recently issued reports about the company. Liberum Capital reaffirmed a buy rating and issued a GBX 135 ($1.74) price objective on shares of Jimmy Choo PLC in a research report on Tuesday, July 5th. HSBC reaffirmed a buy rating and issued a GBX 165 ($2.12) price objective on shares of Jimmy Choo PLC in a research report on Monday, June 27th. Jimmy Choo PLC (Jimmy Choo) is a United Kingdom-based footwear company. The Company offers its products, including shoes, bags, fragrances and eyewear under the brand Jimmy Choo. The Company’s operating segments include retail (including online), wholesale and other. The Retail segment’s revenue is generated through the sale of goods to end consumers via Jimmy Choo directly operated stores in Europe, the United States, Hong Kong, China and Japan and via its Website. Jimmy Choo PLC Jimmy Choo PLC
